title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: cogxwalkr R package designed facilitate crosswalking—translating effect estimates—different cognitive outcome measures studies cognitive aging, exposures, interventions. enables researchers compare results across studies use different cognitive tests. package implements methods described (Ackley et al. 2025). manuscript authors developed two methods crosswalk estimated treatment effects cognitive outcomes flexible, broadly applicable, work summary statistics available, rely strong distributional assumptions. method requires access dataset includes cognitive measure wish crosswalk cognitive measure wish crosswalk . package developed Sarah Ackley Jason Gantenberg. vignette demonstrates use cogxwalkr R.

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: install package, first need install load remotes package, can R console: install package:
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jrgant/cogxwalkr")

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: may get error message reads: likely cause remotes detects bad Github token credential store. Run gitcreds::gitcreds_delete(), select option 2 remove bad credential store, rerun remotes::install_github() command . Alternatively, may get similar error message reads: case, run Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT = "") rerun remotes::install_github() command .
code: Using GitHub PAT from the git credential store. Error: Failed to install 'remotes' from GitHub:   HTTP error 401.   Bad credentials Using github PAT from envvar GITHUB_PAT. Use `gitcreds::gitcreds_set()` and unset GITHUB_PAT in .Renviron (or elsewhere) if you want to use the more secure git credential store instead. Error: Failed to install 'cogxwalkr' from GitHub:   HTTP error 401.   Bad credentials

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: motivating example, consider study estimating effect APOE-ε4 carrier status scores MMSE (Mini-Mental State Examination). wish compare effect results another study used MoCA (Montreal Cognitive Assessment), need conversion factor allows us convert summary measure MMSE scale MoCA scale. cogxwalkr aids estimating conversion coefficient required crosswalk MMSE MoCA following general assumptions regarding two cognitive measures (Ackley et al. 2025): measure underlying construct (e.g., executive function, global cognition, etc.) correlated measurement common construct.

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: load package:
code: library(cogxwalkr)

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: crosswalk methods require individual-level data adjunct study: study cognitive measures performed participant. package, built-cogsim dataset represents adjunct study data. adjunct data simulated data based Alzheimer’s Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI). dataset includes MMSE score MoCA score conditional binary dementia status (0 absent 1 present) approximately 1500 study participants. Code used fit simulate data can found . view example adjunct study, cogsim, can type either following R console: Additional information available via ?cogsim. implement two methods obtain crosswalk slopes: 1) unconditional method 2) conditional method. unconditional method requires data cognitive measures individual, whereas conditional method requires additional data third binary variable, dementia status.
code: head(cogsim) View(cogsim)

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: obtain estimate crosswalk slope using unconditional method can use crosswalk function, workhorse package: estimates crosswalk slope cog1, MMSE, cog2, MoCA, using built-cogsim data adjunct data. cog1 cog2 must supplied strings. niter gives number random splits used obtain crosswalk. built-cogsim dataset can replaced dataset containing appropriate columns. Since uses adjunct data without bootstrap resampling, uncertainty crosswalked slope presented.
code: crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse", cog2 = "moca", data = cogsim, niter = 500) crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse",           cog2 = "moca",           data = cogsim,           niter = 500,           control = list(nboot = 100, seed = 123))  crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse",           cog2 = "moca",           data = cogsim,           niter = 500,           control = list(nboot = 100, seed = 123456, ncores = 8))

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: unconditional method can also used based summary statistics. (many cases, may statistically efficient , number unconditional split iterations must chosen care.) summary statistics approach accessible directly via est_cw_coef() function. However, recommend using crosswalk() functions cogxwalkr built act upon output, est_cw_coef(). Omitting niter argument calling crosswalk() result package using “lm” method estimate crosswalk:
code: # estimate slope using lm() est_cw_coef(cog1 = "mmse", cog2 = "moca", data = cogsim, method = "lm")  # estimate slope using manual calculation est_cw_coef(cog1 == "mmse", cog2 = "moca", data = cogsim, method = "manual") crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse", cog2 = "moca", data = cogsim)

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: use conditional method, must specify additional binary variable perform conditional splits. optional condition_by input declares input , present, elicit conditional method. Note crosswalk() ignore niter condition_by specified.
code: crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse",           cog2 = "moca",           data = cogsim,           condition_by = "dementia")

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: crosswalk() outputs list containing results estimation procedure,1 along information specifications selected user. Similar glm() lm(), cogxwalkr package comes functions help summarize results.2 outputs summary() can stored objects (lists). view raw form object, use print.AsIs(). See documentation summary.cogxwalkr() information options concerning α\alpha level method used estimate bootstrapped confidence intervals.
code: boot_settings <- list(nboot = 100, seed = 999, ncores = 1)  # summary statistics estimation cws <- crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse",                 cog2 = "moca",                 data = cogsim,                 control = boot_settings) #> `ncores` is set to 1 (default). To use parallel processing, set `ncores` to the desired number of cores or to 999 to use the maximum available. #> Running bootstraps over 1 cores ... summary(cws) #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Crosswalk Summary (Adjunct) #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Formula:         moca ~ mmse #> Coefficient:     1.247 #>  #> 95% confidence limits: #>   (1.170, 1.323) - normal #>   (1.174, 1.317) - percentile #>  #>   Based on 100 bootstrap replicates #>   SE = 0.0391 #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Number of iterations:  #> Conditioning variable:   # unconditional split cwu <- crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse",                  cog2 = "moca",                  data = cogsim,                  niter = 500,                  control = boot_settings) #> `ncores` is set to 1 (default). To use parallel processing, set `ncores` to the desired number of cores or to 999 to use the maximum available. #> Running bootstraps over 1 cores ... summary(cwu) #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Crosswalk Summary (Adjunct) #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Formula:         moca ~ mmse - 1 #> Coefficient:     1.154 #>  #> 95% confidence limits: #>   (1.012, 1.296) - normal #>   (1.105, 1.375) - percentile #>  #>   Based on 100 bootstrap replicates #>   SE = 0.0725 #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Number of iterations: 500 #> Conditioning variable:  # conditional split cwc <- crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse",                  cog2 = "moca",                  data = cogsim,                  condition_by = "dementia",                  control = boot_settings) #> `ncores` is set to 1 (default). To use parallel processing, set `ncores` to the desired number of cores or to 999 to use the maximum available. #> Running bootstraps over 1 cores ... summary(cwc) #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Crosswalk Summary (Adjunct) #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Formula:         moca ~ mmse - 1 #> Coefficient:     1.389 #>  #> 95% confidence limits: #>   (1.290, 1.489) - normal #>   (1.299, 1.496) - percentile #>  #>   Based on 100 bootstrap replicates #>   SE = 0.0506 #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Number of iterations: 204 #> Conditioning variable: dementia

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: general, leave plotting output, results, etc., user. package provide simple plot output allow users review interim results quickly. use cwu object saved prior section example. object contains results crosswalk estimation used unconditional split method, along bootstrapping estimate 95% confidence intervals. cxsum argument takes summary output overlays confidence intervals.  Alternatively, used summary statistics method (cws ), see something bit different. longer plot split differences.  Finally, conducted splitting method without bootstrapping, can suppress bootstrap plot panel follows.  , summary.cogxwalkr(), additional options plotting available documentation plot.cogxwalkr().
code: plot(cwu, cxsum = summary(cwu)) plot(cws) #> The crosswalk() object does not contain differences, most likely because the slope was calculated using the manual method and not unconditional splits. The scatterplot has been omitted. cwu_noboot <- crosswalk(cog1 = "mmse", cog2 = "moca", data = cogsim, niter = 500) plot(cwu_noboot, types = "slope")

title: Getting Started with cogxwalkr
text: Let’s say estimated crosswalk MMSE MoCA adjunct data. ’ll use cwu example. come across summary data another (fictional) study describes difference MMSE APOE-ε4 carrier status versus (-2.4, SE = 0.064, 95% CL: [-2.52, -2.27]) like know difference MoCA sample. case, can use do_crosswalk() one two ways obtain estimate: using either standard error summary data confidence interval. crosswalk element list returned contains estimated mean, standard error, (1−α1-\alpha)% confidence interval (default α=0.05\alpha=0.05), accounting uncertainty crosswalk estimate published summary.3 case, see estimated difference MoCA comparing APOE-ε4 carriers non-carriers -2.87 (SE = 0.140, 95% CI: [-3.15, -2.60]), based information dcw_se.
code: pub_outcome_label <- "mmse" pub_pred_label <- "apoe4"  # using the standard error dcw_se <- do_crosswalk(cwu, est_mean = -2.4, est_se = 0.064,                        est_indep = pub_pred_label, est_outcome = pub_outcome_label)  # using the confidence interval dcw_ci <- do_crosswalk(cwu, est_mean = -2.4, est_ci = c(-2.52, -2.27),                        est_indep = pub_pred_label, est_outcome = pub_outcome_label)  # results will differ slightly due to rounding error dcw_se #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Crosswalk Summary #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Adjunct Estimate: #>     1.154, SE: 0.0537 #>     moca ~ mmse - 1 #>  #> Study Estimate: #>     -2.400, SE: 0.064 #>     mmse ~ apoe4 #>  #> Crosswalked Estimate: #>     -2.769, SE: 0.149 #>     95% confidence limits: (-3.060, -2.478) #> -------------------------------------------------- dcw_ci #>  #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Crosswalk Summary #> -------------------------------------------------- #> Adjunct Estimate: #>     1.154, SE: 0.0537 #>     moca ~ mmse - 1 #>  #> Study Estimate: #>     -2.400, SE: 0.0638 #>     mmse ~ apoe4 #>  #> Crosswalked Estimate: #>     -2.769, SE: 0.148 #>     95% confidence limits: (-3.060, -2.478) #> --------------------------------------------------

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sarah Ackley. Author, copyright holder. Jason Gantenberg. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ackley S, Gantenberg J (2025). cogxwalkr: Crosswalk Cognitive Measures. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://jrgant.github.io/cogxwalkr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cogxwalkr: Crosswalk Cognitive Measures},   author = {Sarah Ackley and Jason Gantenberg},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://jrgant.github.io/cogxwalkr/}, }

title: Bootstrap control list — boot_control
text: Bootstrap control list

title: Bootstrap control list — boot_control
code: boot_control(nboot = NULL, seed = NULL, ncores = 1L)

title: Bootstrap control list — boot_control
text: nboot Number bootstrap replicates produce. seed Seed used initialize parallel processing-safe random number generation. ncores Number cores use parallel processing. Defaults 1.

title: Bootstrap control list — boot_control
text: Can used argument control argument crosswalk(), intended primarily validate list provided argument.

title: Calculate bootstrapped confidence limits — bootstrap_ci
text: Calculate bootstrapped confidence limits

title: Calculate bootstrapped confidence limits — bootstrap_ci
code: bootstrap_ci(cx, alpha = 0.05, type = "percentile")

title: Calculate bootstrapped confidence limits — bootstrap_ci
text: cx object class "cogxwalkr", .e., object returned crosswalk(). alpha Alpha level use confidence interval calculation type Type confidence limits calculate. Currently supported: percentile, normal.

title: Bootstrap a split routine — bootstrap_crosswalk
text: Bootstrap split routine

title: Bootstrap a split routine — bootstrap_crosswalk
code: bootstrap_crosswalk(..., nboot, ncores = 1L, seed)

title: Bootstrap a split routine — bootstrap_crosswalk
text: ... Pass arguments crosswalk() nboot Number bootstrap replicates generate ncores Number cores use parallel processing. set 999, parallelly::availableCores() use maximum available seed Seed used doRNG generate reproducible parallel computations

title: Simulated cognitive data — cogsim
text: simulated dataset based subset ADNIMERGE dataset Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)

title: Simulated cognitive data — cogsim
code: cogsim

title: Simulated cognitive data — cogsim
text: data.table containing 1,557 rows 4 columns: subid Integer. Subject ID dementia Integer. Binary indicator dementia mmse Integer. Analagous MMSE_bl ADNIMERGE moca Integer. Analagous MOCA_bl ADNIMERGE

title: Simulated cognitive data — cogsim
text: https://adni.loni.usc.edu

what: Estimate crosswalk between cognitive measures — crosswalk
title: Estimate crosswalk between cognitive measures — crosswalk
text: Estimate crosswalk cognitive measures

title: Estimate crosswalk between cognitive measures — crosswalk
code: crosswalk(   cog1,   cog2,   data,   niter = NULL,   condition_by = NULL,   condition_loop = FALSE,   control = NULL )  est_cw_coef(cog1, cog2, data, method = "lm")

title: Estimate crosswalk between cognitive measures — crosswalk
text: cog1 name first cognitive measure column cog2 name second cognitive measure column data data.table, data.frame, matrix, list containing cognitive measure data niter Number iterations conduct unconditional split routine condition_by name conditioning variable splits conducted. conducted, function use unconditional splits. condition_loop Whether conduct conditional splitting sequentially. Defaults FALSE maximize speed. Unused condition_by NULL. See documentation make_conditional_splits() details. control list settings passed bootstrap_crosswalk(). See boot_control() information. method Either 'lm' (recommended) 'manual'. former fit linear regression model return fit object, latter return table containing covariance cognitive measures (cov), variance measure input cog1 (var), estimated sloped (coef).

title: Estimate crosswalk between cognitive measures — crosswalk
text: Unlike crosswalk(), uses splitting estimate sample coefficient, est_cw_coef() calculates coefficient based summary statistics input data: cov(cog1, cog2) / var(cog1).

title: Estimate crosswalk between cognitive measures — crosswalk
Crosswalk an effect estimate — do_crosswalk
text: Crosswalk effect estimate

title: Crosswalk an effect estimate — do_crosswalk
code: do_crosswalk(   object,   est_mean = NULL,   est_se = NULL,   est_ci = NULL,   est_alpha = 0.05,   alpha = 0.05,   est_indep = NULL,   est_outcome = NULL )

title: Crosswalk an effect estimate — do_crosswalk
text: object object class cogxwalkr result est_cw_coef() est_mean Point estimate (beta) crosswalked alternative outcome measure est_se standard error est_mean est_ci lower (1-alpha)% confidence interval est_mean est_alpha alpha level confidence interval (est_se provided) alpha level used back-calculate standard error est_ci. Defaults 0.05. alpha alpha level confidence interval crosswalked estimate. Defaults 0.05. est_indep independent variable est_mean applies est_outcome outcome measure original study (e.g., "MOCA", "MMSE")

title: Plot information about the bootstrap distribution — plot.cogxwalkr
text: x object class "cogxwalkr", .e., returned crosswalk(). ... Unused cxsum output summary(cx) types types crosswalk plots produce. default, plot bootstrap distribution coefficients plot data estimated slope. plotted sloped, (1-alpha)% confidence intervals appear user provides output summary.cogxwalkr(). breaks Passed graphics::hist(), overriding default method "FD" (grDevices::nclass.FD()). citype Choose confidence intervals plot. Ignored cxsum NULL. layout Passed mfrow argument graphics::par(). Defaults c(1, length(types)). sargs List parameters passed graphics::abline() plots sample coefficient estimate bargs List parameters passed graphics::abline() plots mean coefficient estimate across bootstrap replicates slargs List parameters passed graphics::abline() plots sample slope crosswalk panel clargs List parameters passed graphics::abline() calls plot confidence limits slope. ptshape Shape points crosswalk scatterplot (passed base::plot()) ptsize Size points crosswalk scatterplot (passed base::plot()) ptcol Color points crosswalk scatterplot (passed base::plot()) ptalpha Alpha (transparency) points crosswalk scatterplot (passed base::plot())

title: Make an unconditional split dataset — make_unconditional_splits
code: make_unconditional_splits(data, niter = NULL)  make_conditional_splits(cdvar = NULL, data, loop = FALSE)  make_splits(cdvar = NULL, data, cdloop = FALSE, niter = NULL)

title: Make an unconditional split dataset — make_unconditional_splits
text: data data.table, data.frame, matrix, list containing cognitive measure data niter Number iterations conduct unconditional split routine cdvar Character string naming auxiliary variable condition splits loop Boolean declaring whether use loop. default FALSE generate splits operate expanded data.table -memory. machine limited memory, set argument TRUE order process splits sequentially. default option much faster. cdloop Boolean passed loop argument make_conditional_splits(). Ignored conducting unconditional splits.
